derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin squalidus, from squalere 'be rough or dirty'

entry.tran: 肮脏的;邋遢的;条件差的
entry.def: A squalid place is dirty, untidy, and in bad condition.

example.ex: He followed her up a rickety staircase to a squalid bedsit...
example.tran: 他跟着她上了一段摇摇晃晃的楼梯，来到了一间邋遢的卧室起居室两用房间。

example.ex: The migrants have been living in squalid conditions.
example.tran: 移民们的生活条件一直非常差。

entry.def: Squalid activities are unpleasant and often dishonest.

example.ex: The Tory Party called the bill 'the most squalid measure ever put before the Commons'.
example.tran: 保守党称该议案为“有史以来向下议院提出的最卑鄙的议案”。

sentences.sentence: "sleazy storefronts with...dirt on the walls"- Seattle Weekly
"the sordid details of his orgies stank under his very nostrils"- James Joyce
"the squalid atmosphere of intrigue and betrayal"
"a flyblown bar on the edge of town"
"a squalid overcrowded apartment in the poorest part of town"

sentences.en: They live in a squalid hut in the poorest part of the village.
